verses.verse: ((Ps. 93:3, 4)) Though its waters roar and be troubled, Though the mountains shake with its swelling. Selah
There is a ((Ezek. 47:1-12)) river whose streams shall make glad the (Ps. 48:1, 8; Is. 60:14) city of God, The holy place of the tabernacle of the Most High.
God is ((Deut. 23:14; Is. 12:6); Ezek. 43:7; Hos. 11:9; (Joel 2:27; Zeph. 3:15; Zech. 2:5, 10, 11; 8:3)) in the midst of her, she shall not be moved; God shall help her, just at the break of dawn.
(Ps. 2:1, 2) The nations raged, the kingdoms were moved; He uttered His voice, the earth melted.
The (Num. 14:9; 2 Chr. 13:12) LORD of hosts is with us; The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah
Come, behold the works of the LORD, Who has made desolations in the earth.
(Is. 2:4) He makes wars cease to the end of the earth; (Ps. 76:3) He breaks the bow and cuts the spear in two; (Ezek. 39:9) He burns the chariot in the fire.
Be still, and know that I am God; ((Is. 2:11, 17)) I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth!
The LORD of hosts is with us; The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah
